p: Due to the complex phenomena and many feedback loops, mechanistic models are needed to dissect the cause and effect of the different components ( Box 1) [ 95]. The role of modelling is two-fold: first, mathematical modelling provides a common language to integrate heterogeneous mechanisms and test competitive hypotheses. By doing so, models contribute to building basic knowledge about infection processes. Second, modelling enables assessment of potential intervention scenarios by predicting their impact.
